intro: Haagea dipetala, commonly known as the two-petaled rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are basal, pinnately divided, and covered in a fine layer of white wax. Haagea dipetala is often found in open habitats such as slopes, cliffs, and disturbed areas.
